title: FPI investments in primary market nearly halve in FY26
summary: Foreign investors reduced selling in Indian stocks this fiscal year. However, their investment in initial public offerings and qualified institutional placements also dropped significantly. This trend suggests a waning interest in Indian equities. Meanwhile, domestic mutual funds continued their strong support with consistent inflows, remaining net buyers throughout the period.

title: Rupee, stocks to get tariff-truce boost, investors say
summary: US President Trump announced a significant reduction in tariffs on Indian goods, lowering them from 25% to 18%. This move, linked to India's agreement to halt Russian oil purchases, is expected to strengthen the rupee and boost Indian stocks. Strategists anticipate positive impacts across various asset classes and export-oriented sectors.

title: SGBs lose tax glitter after Budget 2026, tumble 8-10%
summary: Sovereign Gold Bonds (SGBs) experienced a significant drop of 8-10% as investors shied away from the secondary market following the government's withdrawal of tax benefits on capital gains at maturity. This move, coupled with falling gold prices, has prompted wealth managers to advise investors to re-evaluate their investment strategies.

title: Stock markets’ over 1% bounceback reflects clarity on tax
summary: Indian stock markets bounced back on Monday. The Nifty and Sensex recovered from budget day losses. This rebound followed a global sell-off in commodities and precious metals. Foreign investors sold shares, while domestic investors bought them.

summary: NMDC reported a consolidated net profit of  ₹1,747 crore for Q3FY26, an 8% decline from  ₹1,896 crore last year, due to rising operating expenses. Revenue rose 16% to  ₹7,610 crore compared to  ₹6,567 crore in the same quarter last year.

title: Advent re-enters Aditya Birla Capital with  ₹2,750 crore housing finance deal
summary: The deal values Aditya Birla Housing Finance at  ₹19,250 crore and is the latest in a string of foreign investments in India’s financial sector.

title: Engineers India in talks to develop Guyana's first oil refinery, says CMD Vartika Shukla
summary: EIL is pursuing a project management role in Guyana's first oil refinery, crucial for India's energy strategy. As a significant oil importer, India seeks preferential rates and aims to strengthen ties with Guyana to ensure stable oil supply as demand grows.

title: A handshake with the Don: Why Ambani and Adani stocks are cheering the India-US deal
summary: Reliance and Adani Group stocks surged after the India-US trade deal slashed tariffs and opened access to Venezuelan crude, triggering a massive short-covering rally. Adani Group firms emerged as the top gainers, while Reliance stands to benefit from heavier crude imports. Analysts say improved trade clarity could revive FPI flows and strengthen market sentiment.

title: Gold-silver ratio slips to near 60: What does it signal for precious metal investors?
summary: Gold-silver ratio measures the relative value between the two metals. It signals how many ounces of silver will be needed to buy an ounce of gold.&nbsp;

title: PB Fintech shares get the cold shoulder despite decent Q3 performance
summary: Positives such as 37% year-on-year revenue growth to  ₹1,771 crore were overshadowed by news that the company’s board was slated to meet on 5 February to consider raising capital through a qualified institutional placement to pursue inorganic growth opportunities abroad.

title: Radhika Gupta says action ‘more expensive’ in volatile market conditions: 'Those who have kept away from FOMO...'
summary: Edelweiss chief Radhika Gupta feels that investors taking action during market volatility is “more expensive” and that those who keep calm, stay away from FOMO and remain invested in such conditions “will do well”.

title: Sensex jumps over 2,000 points, investors earn over  ₹12 lakh crore— 10 key highlights from Indian stock market today
summary: Indian stock markets surged on February 3 following the confirmation of the India-US trade deal, with the BSE Sensex rising 2.54% and the Nifty 50 climbing 2.55%. The market capitalization increased by over  ₹12.5 lakh crore in a single day.

title: Copper price today is on an uptrend after falling on two straight sessions. What's next in the near term?

title: 13 midcap stocks deliver record quarterly profits over 10 quarters
summary: Thirteen NSE midcap companies reported record quarterly net profits over the past ten quarters, reflecting strong earnings momentum, operational improvements and favourable market conditions. title: Chemical stocks surge up to 19% on US-India trade deal. Why brokerages see Aarti, UPL, 2 more stocks as top beneficiaries
summary: Chemical stocks surged as the US-India trade deal lowered export tariffs to 18%, boosting margins, volumes and competitiveness. Brokerages cite operating leverage, China-plus-one benefits and rupee strength as key drivers supporting a sharp sector-wide rally.

title: Amid soaring gold, silver rates today, ICICI Pru AMC's Sankaran Naren thinks differently; here's why
summary: Following a steep drop, gold prices surged 4.2% as the India-U.S. trade agreement boosted market sentiment. However, fund manager Sankaran Naren warns that investing in gold and silver as standalone assets is no longer advisable, advocating for a multi-asset approach.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Feb 03: Welspun Living, LT Foods, Aarti Industries, Ather Energy, Trident among top gainers
summary: The Indian stock market surged on February 3 following the US-India trade deal, which reduced tariffs on Indian exports. The Nifty 50 and S&amp;P Sensex saw substantial gains, and the rupee appreciated against the dollar, marking a positive trend in investor sentiment.

title: Three MDs quit Peak XV Partners as senior-level exits continue
summary: Amid the ongoing leadership shuffle, Peak XV Partners has lost three managing directors. The venture capital firm is refining its investment strategy post-Sequoia split, promoting new leaders to enhance operations and focus on AI investments.

title: NRI LTCG tax relief: Clawback applies in year of share sale
summary: Under India's taxation rules, if the new asset acquired for the purpose of claiming capital gains exemption is sold or otherwise converted into money within a period of three years from the date of its acquisition, the exemption earlier availed is required to be reversed.

title: Gainers & Losers: RIL, HDFC Bank and Eternal among 7 top movers on Tuesday
summary: Indian markets surged after the India-US trade deal boosted investor sentiment across sectors. Reliance, HDFC Bank, Adani stocks and chemicals led gains, while select stocks like PB Fintech and Bharat Coking Coal lagged despite broader market strength.

title: Trump’s trade tweet hands India tariff relief, but at a strategic cost
summary: The India-US trade truce calms markets with tariff relief, but Trump’s terms suggest steep concessions for India on energy, imports and geopolitics. Unclear safeguards, leverage-linked tariffs and silence on services raise concerns over an imbalanced, America-first agreement.

title: Lupin, SBI among 6 stocks that hit 52-week high; rally up to 7% in a month
summary: A sharp rally in Indian equities pushed the Sensex up nearly 2,072 points, lifting market sentiment. The broader momentum drove six BSE 100 stocks to fresh 52-week highs, signalling strong bullish momentum. Such breakouts are seen as positive technical indicators, suggesting potential for further upside in select frontline stocks.

title: Bain-backed Dhoot Transmission files confidential draft paper for potential $250 million IPO
summary: Shares will have a face value of  ₹2 each and are planned for listing on both BSE and NSE, the company said.

title: Bajaj Finance Q3 Results: Net profit falls 5.6% to  ₹4,066 crore; NII surges to  ₹11,318 crore
summary: Bajaj Finance reported a 5.6% decline in consolidated net profit to  ₹4,066 crore for the December quarter, down from  ₹4,308 crore last year. Sequentially, net profit fell 18% from  ₹4,947 crore in September. Net interest income rose to  ₹11,318 crore from  ₹9,383 crore last year.

title: Mint Explainer: What’s causing gold prices to fall, and what should you do now?

title: India-US trade deal: Will retail investors' patience pay off in the Indian stock market? Explained
summary: India-US trade deal has lifted market sentiment, prompting optimism for foreign investments. Analysts predict that retail investors' patience will pay off, but not immediately, as mid- and small-cap stocks could see significant gains over the next few years.

title: Who is Stephan Bugaj? JioStar Group appoints Emmy Award winner as Senior VP of GenAI Content & Technology
summary: JioStar Group has appointed Stephan Bugaj as Senior Vice-President of GenAI Content and Technology to enhance AI-driven digital experiences. His extensive background in interactive storytelling and AI tools aims to drive innovation in content creation and audience engagement.

summary: Iran-US tensions: IndiGo has issued a travel advisory due to flight cancellations on certain routes related to tensions between Iran and the US. Passengers are advised to check flight statuses and consider alternate options, including refunds, as the situation evolves.

title: Indus Towers bets on 5G growth and overseas expansion for revenue
summary: Indus Towers expects revenue growth from 5G expansion, rising data usage and overseas forays in Africa and the UAE. Management said customer payment issues have stabilised, tenancy additions are improving, and long-term tower demand remains strong despite moderated rollout pace.

title: PayPal forecasts weak 2026 profit outlook, misses Q4 revenue, stock plunges nearly 16%
summary: PayPal announces the appointment of HP's Enrique Lores as its incoming president and CEO

title: Mankind's profit, revenue miss estimates in Q3, revenue rises 11.5%
summary: The drugmaker’s revenue grew to  ₹3,567 crore in Q3 while its net profit grew 9.5% year-on-year to  ₹414 crore. Profit declined sequentially by 20.4%.

title: Rocket Companies shares jump 6% after CEO says mortgage loan volume is surging
summary: CEO Varun Krishna said his company is poised to post its strongest mortgage loan production in four years after a drop in borrowing costs helped revive demand.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday
summary: Nifty saw profit-taking after a gap-up opening but held above key Fibonacci and moving average supports. Analysts flagged a shift to buy-on-dips, cooling volatility and improving momentum, even as global markets weakened and select heavyweights influenced overall market sentiment.

summary: Nifty surged on the India-US trade deal but formed a large red candle amid profit-taking. Still, holding key Fibonacci support shifted sentiment to buy-on-dips, with analysts flagging support near 25,500 and select stock buying opportunities.

title: US trade deal: At Rs 5,236 crore, FIIs buying in Indian stocks is the highest in over three months
summary: Foreign investors returned strongly to Indian equities after the India-US trade deal eased tariff fears. FIIs logged their biggest single-day buying since October, lifting stocks, strengthening the rupee and improving bond market sentiment amid hopes of trade stability.

summary: Our technical analysts identify select stocks that may gain momentum even in volatile markets. Here are the technical calls for today.

summary: Gold and silver have rebounded after a two-day sell-off, with Comex gold rising 7% to $4,975 per troy ounce and silver gaining nearly 15% to $88.4 per troy ounce. Recent price drops were influenced by market reactions to Federal Reserve changes and increased margin requirements.

title: Wall Street mixed as investors brace for corporate earnings
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.02%, the S&amp;P 500 gained 0.15%, the Nasdaq Composite gained 0.34%

title: Fractal Analytics nearly halves IPO size as valuation leaves PEs unhappy
summary: Fractal Analytics is likely to be valued at around  ₹18,000 crore, or about $2 billion, lower than the $2.44 billion valuation it fetched in its last fundraise.

title: Adani Ports raises FY26 guidance following robust Q3 growth
summary: Adani Enterprises' earnings, on the other hand, were muted, but a significant uptick in Ebitda is expected as key projects become operational.

title: PhonePe IPO: How the company's large user base supports expansion beyond payments
summary: PhonePe's Draft Red Herring Prospectus reveals operational revenue of  ₹3,918 crore in H1 FY26, driven largely by payments. Despite a net loss of  ₹1,444 crore, the company processed 48% of India’s UPI transactions, underscoring the importance of transaction volume to revenue.

title: UPI transactions surge to record high of  ₹230 trillion till December 2025: Govt
summary: Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions till December 2025 touched a record high of  ₹230 trillion, amid the government's digital payments push.&nbsp;

title: Time to be selectively bullish again? 8 mid-cap stocks from different sectors with an upside potential of up to 41%
summary: News of the India-US trade deal finally taking place saw the Nifty and Sensex registering a sharp jump. Don't expect a similar reaction every day. But with a major “event risk” behind it, the chances are that the street will see greater risk appetite. So, directionally, you can up your bullish quotient. At the same time, it would be prudent to be cautious and selective when it comes to mid-cap stocks. Reason: While mid-caps have witnessed a correction, their valuations are still not cheap. But chosen with proper checks and balances, the probability of these stocks performing well has increased sharply.

title: Deepinder Goyal drops a personal, emotional, heartfelt note for ex-employees who quit or were asked to leave Zomato
summary: Deepinder Goyal stepped down as CEO of Eternal on 21 January 2026 and was succeeded by Albinder Singh Dhindsa. Goyal invited former employees to return, emphasising the company's evolution and the need for experienced individuals to help grow its diverse businesses.

title: OpenAI ‘will remain a Nvidia customer for a long time’, CEO Sam Altman dismisses chip concerns
summary: Nvidia and OpenAI affirmed that they maintain a strong partnership despite reports of tension. Here's what the issue is all about and how the executives clarified it.&nbsp;
